result.execSummary:
The defendant Salena A Nelson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Partial payment plan:  $50 per month.  2 day(s) RCJ for contempt for failure to pay.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Salena A Nelson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Salena A Nelson in court with attorney Jennifer Marie Severino.  Christopher D. Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
  Plea - NC.
BTC: GUILTY.
$200+cc+DNA, pp $50/mo beg 10/1/15 , ftp 2 days RCJ for contempt.
Status conference on August 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on July 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 18, 2015 at 03:15 pm.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. or between 1:00 p.m. and 4:00 p.m.  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Salena A Nelson in court.  Brian Van Schyndel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set. BTC: WARRANT VACATED  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 03:15 pm.  Status conference scheduled for July 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
